abstract.p: National Trust for Historic Preservation lists 11 most endangered historic places; list; photos (S)

block.p: Since 1988 the National Trust for Historic Preservation has released ''America's 11 Most Endangered Historic Places,'' an annual list of sites threatened by neglect, public policy or vandalism. Its inent is to heighten public awareness of various threats to the nation's heritage, from the dilapidation of hospital wards on Ellis Island to termite infestations of historic buildings in the South to the construction of a superhighway near Montana's Flathead Indian reservation. The 1997 sites are these:
Congressional Cemetery Washington, D.C. Founded 1807
Ellis Island National Monument New York Harbor Built in the early 1900's
Stillwater Bridge Stillwater, Minn. Built in 1931
Vicksburg Campaign Trail Louisiana and Mississippi 1863
Montezsuma Castle Montezsuma, N.M. Built circa 1881
Crainston Street Armory Providence, R.I. Built in 1907
The Cathedral of St. Vibiana Los Angeles Built in 1876
Wa'ahila Ridge Honolulu, Hawaii
Flathead Indian Reservation Northwest Montana Created by the Hellgate Treaty of 1855
Historic Buildings infested with Formosan termites Gulf States, most severe in New Orleans Built from the late 18th century until World War II
Bridge of Lions St. Augustine, Fla. Built in 1927
Source: National Trust for Historic Preservation
